com.sap.conn.jco.ext

Interface ServerDataProvider


  • public interface ServerDataProvider
    Applications using the JCoServer functionality, i.e. applications that provide a function module in Java that is invoked by an ABAP program, need to manage the server configuration parameters. ServerDataProvider is the interface to be implemented by an infrastructure component within such applications. It is not the responsibility of the business application logic to provide and register such an implementation. A business application is only providing the implementation of the function module. The concept is similar to DestinationDataProvider.

    There are three different setups for a server:

    1. single gateway: With this setup, JCoServer connects to exactly one given gateway.
    2. multiple gateways: The server is connecting to multiple gateways simultaneously. The group of application servers to connect to is fetched from a message server, represented as a logon group. If no logon group is given, all application servers of that ABAP system are connected. The specified connection count determines, how many connections to each gateway are set up.
      To implement this scenario successfully, in the destination configuration (SM59) all gateway host and service fields need to be empty, i.e. for each application server the local gateway is used.
      If not all required gateways can be connected successfully, the JCoServer will be in state JCoServerState#HA_BROKEN.
    3. WebSocket: JCoServer does not connect to any gateway, it is running standalone on a specified port and waiting for incoming WebSocket RFC connections. If you are running a TLS-secured server (which mostly is the case), you need to override getSSlServerContext() and provide a SSLContext instance which is used to setup the trust to any client.

    The ServerDataProvider provides server configurations to the JCo runtime. The JCo runtime uses the registered instance to get all server configuration information.

    Note:

    • Only one implementation of ServerDataProvider can be registered. For registering a different implementation the infrastructure has first to unregister the instance that is currently registered. It is not recommended to permanently exchange ServerDataProvider registrations. The one registered instance should globally manage all server configurations for the whole infrastructure environment.
    • It is strongly recommended to use a secure persistence layer to store the server configurations.
    • It is strongly recommended to implement event support. Otherwise the configuration changes are not recognized immediately by the JCo runtime so that outdated data might be used. Then, only if a server is looked up again via JCoServerFactory, the data will be updated. Please check out the ServerDataEventListener in order to find out more about the reaction of the JCo runtime to the events.

    The following properties are supported:

    mandatory parameters for a server connecting to a single gateway
    jco.server.gwhost The gateway host at which the JCoServer should be registered.
    jco.server.gwserv The gateway service to be used for registering at the gateway, i.e. symbolic service name or the port number.
    jco.server.progid The program ID for registering and identifying the JCoServer at the gateway.
    jco.server.connection_countThe number of server connections that should be registered at the gateway.
    mandatory parameters for a server connecting to multiple gateways (high availability)
    jco.server.mshost The message server host at which the JCoServer should retrieve information about the application servers to use for the high availability setup.
    jco.server.msserv The message server service to use for connecting to the message server. Either this property or jco.server.system_id needs to be provided.
    jco.server.system_id The system ID of the system the message server belongs to. Either this property or jco.server.msserv needs to be provided.
    jco.server.progid The program ID for registering and identifying the JCoServer at each gateway
    jco.server.connection_countThe number of server connections that should be registered at each gateway
    mandatory parameters for a running WebSocket server
    jco.server.wsport The port at which this server should run at.
    jco.server.connection_countThe number of server connections that are allowed to connect simultaneously.
    optional parameters
    jco.server.saprouter SAProuter string to use for registering at a gateway/message server that is located behind a firewall.
    jco.server.max_startup_delay The maximum time (in seconds) between two startup attempts in case of failures.
    jco.server.repository_destination Destination name for obtaining the default JCoRepository.
    jco.server.repository_map Mapping rule for destination names from ABAP system IDs and clients in order to obtain a matching JCoRepository depending on the incoming RFC requests.
    jco.server.trace RFC trace flag; 1: enabled, 0: disabled (default)
    jco.server.worker_thread_count The maximum number of worker threads used by the JCoServer.
    jco.server.worker_thread_min_countThe minimum number of worker threads used by the JCoServer.
    jco.server.max_connection_count The maximal number of server connections that can be registered at each gateway.
    optional parameters for high availability setup
    jco.server.group The logon group name; connections are established to all containing application servers only. If no name is specified, all available application servers are chosen.
    jco.server.update_interval How often the application server information is fetched from the message server (in ms). If logon group information changes at the message server, it does not push this change, so JCo periodically fetches this information with this interval. This means, if new application servers are added then, new connections are opened as well. Connections to removed application servers are closed smoothly, if they are not longer in use.
    optional parameters for WebSocket setup
    jco.server.use_tls If you want to run an unencrypted server with plain WebSocket RFC, you need to set this property explicitly to 0. This should be only done for debugging and development purposes.
    jco.server.tls_server_partner_authSteers the mode, if this server requires, requests, or does not want to authenticate the client on TLS level.
    jco.server.ws_ping_periodThe idle time period of a WebSocket server connection in seconds after which a keep alive WebSocket ping packet is sent.
    jco.server.ws_pong_timeoutThe timeout for a WebSocket pong packet in seconds.

    The following properties are only used by JCo's server property file based default implementation, i.e. if no ServerDataProvider instance is explicitly registered, and JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1:
    jco.server.tls_p12_file Path to a p12 file containing all trusted entities.
    jco.server.tls_p12_passwdPassword for the specified p12 file. The password is mandatory if a p12 file is used.
    SNC parameters (only required if snc_mode is on)
    jco.server.snc_mode Secure Network Communications (SNC) mode; 1: on, 0: off (default)
    jco.server.snc_qop SNC quality of protection; valid values: 1, 2, 3, 8 (default), 9
    jco.server.snc_mynameSNC name of the JCoServer. Overrides the default SNC name. For example: p:CN=JCoServer, O=ACompany, C=EN
    jco.server.snc_lib Full path to the library which provides the SNC service; default: value from JCo middleware property jco.middleware.snc_lib
    informational parameters (irrelevant for the JCo library)
    jco.server.applicationAssociated or owning application name (may be used for configuration management purposes)

      Properties getServerProperties(String serverName)
      This method shall return a properties object that contains a subset of the supported properties mentioned above which represent the configuration of the given JCoServer in your server configuration repository.

      This method is invoked by the JCo runtime in order to get a SSLContext which is then used to establish a secure connection in case that a WebSocket server shall be established.

      Returns true if the implementation can support ServerDataEvents that allow a better integration into the JCo runtime management.

    • Field Detail

      • JCO_GWHOST

        static final String JCO_GWHOST
        The gateway host at which the JCoServer should be registered.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_GWSERV

        static final String JCO_GWSERV
        Gateway service to be used for registering at the gateway. This can either be a symbolic service name or a port number. If using a symbolic service name like sapgw05 a lookup of the corresponding port number in etc/services is done. In case of port numbers being specified directly no such lookup is performed and no additional entry in etc/services is required.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_MSHOST

        static final String JCO_MSHOST
        message server host, mandatory for a high availability server setup.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        MessageServerDataProvider.MESSAGE_SERVER_HOST, Constant Field Values

      • JCO_MSSERV

        static final String JCO_MSSERV
        message server service name or port number. For high availability connections either this property or jco.server.system_id needs to be provided. In order to resolve the service name sapms<SID> a lookup in etc/services is performed by the network layer of the operating system. If using port numbers instead of symbolic service names, no lookups are performed and no additional entries are needed.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        MessageServerDataProvider.MESSAGE_SERVER_SERVICE, Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SYSTEMID

        static final String JCO_SYSTEMID
        The system ID of the system the message server belongs to. For high availability connections either this property or jco.server.msserv needs to be provided. The value being present will cause a lookup of the logical port sapms<> administrated in /etc/services or should specify the port directly.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        MessageServerDataProvider.SYSTEMID, Constant Field Values

      • JCO_GROUP

        static final String JCO_GROUP
        Logon group of the high availability connections, which is identifying a set of ABAP application servers (optional, default all reachable application servers are used).
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_AS_UPDATE_INTERVAL

        static final String JCO_AS_UPDATE_INTERVAL
        Update time in ms how often new logon information is fetched from the message server (optional, default 5 min).
        If the high availability setup is used, the message server manages information about logon groups. If these settings changes, the message server does not push this update, so JCo periodically fetches this information with this interval.
        This means, if new application servers are added then, new connections are opened as well. Connections to removed application servers are closed smoothly, if they are not longer in use.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:

      • JCO_SNC_QOP

        static final String JCO_SNC_QOP
        SNC quality of protection.
        Valid values:
            1: Authentication only
            2: Authentication and integrity protection
            3: Authentication, integrity and privacy protection (encryption)
            8: Global default configuration (usually: 3)
            9: Maximum protection
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SNC_LIBRARY

        static final String JCO_SNC_LIBRARY
        Full path to the library which provides the SNC service. If this property is not provided, the value from the JCo middleware property jco.middleware.snc_lib is used insteadm, which is not set per default.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_MAX_STARTUP_DELAY

        static final String JCO_MAX_STARTUP_DELAY
        The maximum time (in seconds) between two startup attempts in case of failures. The waiting time is doubled from initially 1 second after each startup failure until either this maximum value is reached or the server could be started successfully. If this property is not provided, the value from the JCo middleware property jco.middleware.max_startup_delay is used instead, whose default is 3600 seconds (= 60 minutes).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_SAPROUTER

        static final String JCO_SAPROUTER
        SAProuter string to use for registering at a gateway that is located behind a firewall and hence can only be reached via a SAProuter. For example: /H/hostname_firewall1/H/hostname_firewall2 In general, a router string has the following format:
        (/H/&lt;host&gt;[/S/&lt;port&gt;][/W/&lt;password&gt;])+
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_REP_DEST

        static final String JCO_REP_DEST
        Destination name for obtaining the default JCoRepository.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_REP_MAP

        static final String JCO_REP_MAP
        Mapping rule for destination names from ABAP system IDs and clients in order to obtain a matching JCoRepository depending on the incoming RFC requests.

        Since JCo 3.0.5 a JCoServer can support more than one repository. In addition to the default JCO_REP_DEST repository applications can define particular repository destinations for a particular ABAP system SID and client combination. For example, it is possible to use the DDIC in system ABC client 000 for calls from system ABC client 000 and the DDIC of system ABC client 100 for calls from client 100, and the DDIC of system XYZ for calls originating from system XYZ. For calls from other systems the system specified by JCO_REP_DEST will be used, which is serving as default repository. By specifying a client the scope for the DDIC to be used can be limited to specific clients within an ABAP system. All other clients of that system will then use the specified destination for the same system without client limitation or if this is not defined, the default repository destination JCO_REP_DEST will be used.

        Repository map definition: 

            jco.server.repository_map=<single_map>(';'<single_map>)*
    <single_map> := <SID>['('<CLIENT>')'](,<SID>['('<CLIENT>')'])*=<DESTINATION>
    where ...
        <single_map> is a single repository mapping expression
        <SID> is the system ID of the SAP ABAP backend (or 'EXTERN' in case of external RFC client programs)
        <CLIENT> is the client of the SAP ABAP backend
        <DESTINATION> is the destination that should be used for DDIC queries if a call is coming
                      from SAP ABAP backend <SID> and - if specified - from client <CLIENT>
        The following example demonstrates how you can use the destination DEFAULT_DEST for all DDIC queries except for calls from PRD. If a call is sent from PRD client 100 or client 200 the destination PRD_DDIC_100 should be used, for all other clients in PRD system the destination PRD_DDIC_000. 
            jco.server.repository_destination=DEFAULT_DEST
    jco.server.repository_map=PRD(100),PRD(200)=PRD_DDIC_100;PRD=PRD_DDIC_000
        Of course you should not forget to define all referenced destinations: DEFAULT_DEST, PRD_DDIC_100 and PRD_DDIC_000
        Since:
        JCo 3.0.5
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_CONNECTION_COUNT

        static final String JCO_CONNECTION_COUNT
        The number of server connections to register at the gateway. In the high availability setup, this value determines the number of connections to each gateway. For a WebSocket server, since there gateway connections do not exist, it is the number of allowed stateless connections to be opened to this server.
        If your ServerDataProvider implementation supports events, you can adjust this number at runtime by firing the update event.
        Please note that stateful connections are established in addition to the stateless ones and are not configured, i.e. if a server connection is set to stateful by an application, JCo will ensure that the configured number of connections is still available for stateless requests. This means, with this connection count you actually configure how many concurrent stateless connections shall be offered.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_MAX_CONNECTION_COUNT

        static final String JCO_MAX_CONNECTION_COUNT
        The maximal number of server connections to be registered at the gateway. In the high availability setup, this value determines the maximal number of connections to each gateway. For a WebSocket server, since there gateway connections do not exist, it is the maximum number of allowed connections to be opened to this server.
        If your ServerDataProvider implementation supports events, you can adjust this maximal allowed number at runtime by firing the update event.
        Please note that this property includes stateful as well as stateless connections. With JCO_CONNECTION_COUNT you specify how many concurrent stateless connections shall be offered, whereas this property allows to limit the number of overall connections. The default value is 0, which means there is no limitation.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_WORKER_THREAD_COUNT

        static final String JCO_WORKER_THREAD_COUNT
        The maximum number of worker threads used by the JCoServer. If not set, the number of server connections (the connection count) is used as the maximum number of worker threads. Initially, the JCo runtime starts JCO_WORKER_THREAD_MIN_COUNT worker threads. Further threads are then started on demand until this maximum is reached.
        If your ServerDataProvider implementation supports events, you can adjust the maximum number of worker threads at runtime by firing the update event.

        Note: the maximum number of worker threads must not exceed 99 threads.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_WORKER_THREAD_MIN_COUNT

        static final String JCO_WORKER_THREAD_MIN_COUNT
        The minimum number of worker threads used by the JCo server. If not set, the number of server connections (the connection count) is used as the minimum number of worker threads.
        If your ServerDataProvider implementation supports events, you can adjust the minimum number of worker threads at runtime by firing the update event.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_APPLICATION

        static final String JCO_APPLICATION
        Associated or owning application name for the configuration. This property is only informative and ignored at runtime. It may be used by infrastructure components for configuration management purposes.
        Since:
        JCo 3.0.14
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_ALLOWED_SYSTEM_IDS

        static final String JCO_ALLOWED_SYSTEM_IDS
        Comma separated list of system IDs which are allowed to call the configured JCoServer. A request from system that is not listed here will be blocked. Note: If no list is provided the JCoServer will allow all Systems to call.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_ALLOWED_SNC_PARTNER_NAMES

        static final String JCO_ALLOWED_SNC_PARTNER_NAMES
        | - separated list of SNC settings which are allowed to call the configured JCoServer. A request from a user that is not listed here will be blocked. Note: If no list is provided the JCoServer will allow everyone to call.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_WSPORT

        static final String JCO_WSPORT
        WebSocket port number to be used for direct WebSocket communication.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_PING_PERIOD

        static final String JCO_PING_PERIOD
        The idle time period of a WebSocket server connection in seconds after which a keep alive WebSocket ping packet is sent. Switching keep alive pinging from off [0] to on [bigger than 10] and vice versa will only affect new RFC connections opened afterwards. This property can be also managed globally for all servers with JCo.setProperty(String, String) and jco.ws.ping_period. (Default: 300, valid values are 0 [off] and a range from 10 [ten seconds] to 86400 [one day])
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_PONG_TIMEOUT

        static final String JCO_PONG_TIMEOUT
        The timeout for a WebSocket keep alive ping reply packet in seconds. If no such so-called pong packet is received from the communication partner as a reply to a previously sent WebSocket keep alive ping packet within this timeout period, the connection is considered as broken and will be closed. Switching keep alive reply pinging from off [0] to on [bigger than 10] and vice versa will only affect new RFC connections opened afterwards. Make sure to choose a value lower than JCO_PING_PERIOD - it is only possible to have one ping active at a time. This property can be also managed globally for all servers with JCo.setProperty(String, String) and jco.ws.pong_timeout. (Default: 60, valid values are 0 [off] and a range from 10 [ten seconds] to 3600 [one hour])
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_USE_TLS

        static final String JCO_USE_TLS
        Specifies if the TLS (Transport Layer Security) protocol shall be used for protecting the communication via a WebSocket. This property is only relevant if JCO_WSPORT is specified. This should be set to 0 only for debugging and development purposes.
        Default is 1.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TLS_SERVER_PARTNER_AUTH

        static final String JCO_TLS_SERVER_PARTNER_AUTH
        If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1, this property steers whether the server should request the client for authentication.
        • NONE The server does not ask for client authentication.
        • REQUEST The server suggests to the peer to provide TLS authentication but continues the TLS handshake also without it.
        • REQUIRED The server requires the client to provide TLS authentication.

        Default is REQUEST.

        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TLS_P12FILE

        static final String JCO_TLS_P12FILE
        If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1 and the default ServerDataProvider implementation is used, this property contains the full path to the p12 file containing all trusted entities.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JCO_TLS_P12PASSWD

        static final String JCO_TLS_P12PASSWD
        If JCO_USE_TLS is set to 1 and the default ServerDataProvider implementation is used, this property contains the mandatory password for the p12 file which is specified via JCO_TLS_P12FILE. The password is mandatory if a p12 file is used.
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getServerProperties

        Properties getServerProperties(String serverName)
                        throws DataProviderException
        This method shall return a properties object that contains a subset of the supported properties mentioned above which represent the configuration of the given JCoServer in your server configuration repository. Returning null means that the server configuration is not available. In this case a JCoException with the key JCO_ERROR_RESOURCE will be thrown.

        The implementation may throw a DataProviderException in order to signal an internal error like a severe technical issue that prevents returning the requested properties data. As a consequence the method JCoServerFactory.getServer() will then throw a JCoException with an appropriate key to the JCo application.

        Parameters:
        serverName - the name of the JCoServer for which the provider should return the properties
        Returns:
        Properties for the JCoServer or null if the server configuration was not found
        Throws:
        DataProviderException - if an internal error occurred or a severe configuration error was detected.

      • supportsEvents

        boolean supportsEvents()
        Returns true if the implementation can support ServerDataEvents that allow a better integration into the JCo runtime management. If the implementation cannot support events it must return false. If you're not sure about the ability that your ServerDataProvider can guarantee to fire all events you may return false to be on the safe side.

        If the implementation can support ServerDataEvents, the JCo runtime will set a ServerDataEventListener that is implemented by JCo.

        Returns:
        whether the implementation fully supports ServerDataEvents
        See Also:
        setServerDataEventListener(ServerDataEventListener)

      • setServerDataEventListener

        void setServerDataEventListener(ServerDataEventListener eventListener)
        This method sets a ServerDataEventListener implemented by JCo that processes the fired events within the JCo runtime.
        The JCo runtime will register only a single ServerDataEventListener instance.
        Parameters:
        eventListener - the ServerDataEventListener to which configuration events need to be fired

      • getSSLServerContext

        default SSLContext getSSLServerContext(String serverName)
                                throws DataProviderException
        This method is invoked by the JCo runtime in order to get a SSLContext which is then used to establish a secure connection in case that a WebSocket server shall be established. If you want to start a WebSocket server, please override this method in your implementation accordingly.
        Parameters:
        serverName - the name of the server for which the provider should return the SSLContext instance.
        Returns:
        the SSLContext which will be used for setting up the server.
        Throws:
        DataProviderException
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.3
